intro: Pimelea suteri, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mulla mulla, is a shrub native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or loamy soils and is found in open woodlands and heathlands. It is well adapted to dry conditions and can thrive in full sun to partial shade. Pimelea suteri is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
